name: envision
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to imagine or expect something to happen, appear, etc. in a particular way: We envision a park with trails and a boating lake. [ + -ing verb ] No one had ever envisioned attempting such a total transformation. She envisions the museum displaying religious art and historical artefacts. [ + that ] I always envisioned that I would return home at some point.
More examplesFewer examplesThe agricultural projects that were envisioned as the foundation of a new economy collapsed.When they hear about the show a lot of people envision something outrageous.We also envision creating an orchard that will provide a food source for wildlife.The candidate envisions the nation relying increasingly on renewable sources of energy.She envisions that in five years the campus will have a large gymnasium and fields, and about 150 students.The law envisioned that offenders would receive therapy at the center. It did not envision that people would be put in there forever.
